Transcription for 1222296

So how did your father and mother meet?
That was an arrangement made by the head of what was termed the Manchester Yeshiva, where
he had gone as a boy of twelve, and the principal of that Yeshiva turned round to my grandfather
who was the treasurer of that institution and said, listen, you've got your youngest
daughter. I think that she should carry on the orthodox tradition. There's a young man
that's come that's got a number of diplomas from the Mere Yeshiva in Poland, and he's
a nice chap in my opinion, and you ought to get together and make a marriage of the two.
So it was, and we've got a picture inside of the actual marriage ceremony taking place
in the Chaikramsul Synagogue.
